intro: Hieracium trichophorum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is typically found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are usually hairy, giving it its common name. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in temperate climates. Hieracium trichophorum is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
